subject: Feature: Add association interfaces to a target EM
commitMessage:
Feature: Add association interfaces to a target EM

This change gives the `gpiopresence` daemon in `dbus-sensors`
the ability to, upon request via configuration EM, generate am
`xyz.openbmc_project.Association.Definitions` object, which is
used by the Object Mapper to generate associations between two
dbus interfaces.

As `gpiopresence` is unaware of what dbus interfaces may or may
not be probing for the interface it generates, it is left to
the user configuring `gpiopresence` to specify the association
via the `AssociationPath`, `AssociationForward`, and the
`AssociationReverse` fields in `GPIOStatus`.

Once set these will equate to the three string values in
`xyz.openbmc_project.Association.Definitions`.

Example:

Here is an example GPIO line being added with an association for the
PCIeSlots bmcweb Redfish resource.

On the mainboard inside the "Exposes" block:

```
    "Exposes": [
        {
            "Name": "example_presence_io_0",
            "GpioLine": "EXAMPLE_IO_R_PRSNT_N",
            "Polarity": "active_low",
            "Type": "GPIOStatus",
            "AssociationPath": "/xyz/openbmc_project/inventory/system/pcieslot/example_slot_0",
            "AssociationForward": "chassis",
            "AssociationReverse": "pcie_slots"
        },
        ...
    ]
```

Then in it's own EM JSON, we define the device itself:

```
[
    {
        "Name": "example_slot_0",
        "Exposes": [],
        "Probe": "xyz.openbmc_project.GPIOStatus({'Name': 'example_presence_io_0'})",
        "xyz.openbmc_project.Inventory.Item": {
          "Present": "$Present"
        },
        "Type": "PCIeSlot",
        "xyz.openbmc_project.Inventory.Item.PCIeSlot": {
            "SlotType": "xyz.openbmc_project.Inventory.Item.PCIeSlot.OEM",
            "HotPluggable": false
        },
        "xyz.openbmc_project.Inventory.Decorator.LocationCode": {
            "LocationCode": "PE0"
        }
    },
    ...
]
```

This feature allows this EM defined PCIeSlot to be correctly associated
with the parent of the `GPIOStatus` interface, in this case the mainboard.

Tested:
Add EM fields to an existing `GPIOStatus` object.
Check that an association is created by `gpiopresence`
as specified.

Signed-off-by: Cody Smith <scody@google.com>
Change-Id: I0572d124a8e9b9fedbdfb30d41fe399e005f5c03

Patch Set 15: Commit message was updated.
Please add more details in the commit message.
What is the use case for this? Looks like association path is static defined in a board configuration file. Is that right? Can you show an example?
I don't see change in commit message.
Just being consistent with the above method, not needed for my feature so I'll revert it.
The difference between (and meaning of) associationPath and parentPath are not clear to me. Like mentioned in commit message comments, maybe an example would help clarify.

`associationPath` is provided by the user configuring `GPIOStatus` and points to that thing that will ultimately be probing off this dbus. In the example we define a PCIeSlot called `example_slot_0` which probes for the existence of a named `GPIOStatus`.

Think of this as the target. We still need a source. X is associated with Y of course so we have the Y and not the X. The X or source is assumed to be the parent of the `GPIOStatus` which is not user defined but instead discovered by the GPIOPresence daemon.

I admit we could name `associationPath` better, I am open to suggestions.
Thanks for the explanation. IMO, sourcePath/thisPath/selfPath is clearer than parentPath. Another option maybe associcationPath->forwardPath and parentPath -> reversePath.
Whether these names needs to be present in entity-manager schema ?
